item.title: Current Topics: Research Data Management Symposium
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Julia Kochi attended the Research Data Management Symposium hosted by the NN/LM Middle Atlantic Region. The Symposium was 1 ½ days and very practical. The first day started off with more “big sky” presentations, and only one of the presenters was affiliated with a library. The second half of the ...

item.title: Current Topics: Educause Learning Initiative, ALA Midwinter Conference
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Jim Munson attended the Educause Learning Initiative 2014 Annual Meeting. “The Educause Learning Initiative is where teaching and learning professionals come to learn, lead, collaborate and share.” Main themes were assessment of student learning, blended & online learning, academic transformation, digital literacies, and the evaluation of instructional innovations. Evaluating Learning ...

item.title: Current Topics: Photoshop World
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Sean Gabriel McClelland attended the Photoshop World conference on September 4-6. His most notable takeaways from the event include: • The Adobe Create Suite of applications is shifting to a subscription model only. The “everything price” is $50/month, which seems expensive, but includes their entire series of industry standard applications, ...

item.title: Current Topics: Handheld Librarian Conference, Rare Books School, and ALA
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Leslie Kleinberg viewed the panel discussion “Responsive Web Design,” part of the Handheld Librarian online conference on June 19. The main points were: Websites must be designed for a broad range of screen sizes and devices. Stop thinking about the “mobile web” vs. the “desktop web.” It’s just the web, ...

item.title: Current Topics: Computers in Libraries, CNI, Society of California Archivists, and Coursera
item.dc:creator: Kate Tasker
item.description:
Library staff provided the scoop on four different professional conferences at last week’s Current Topics meeting.   Michele Mizejewski attended the Computers in Libraries annual conference in Washington, D.C.  Similar to Internet Librarian, this conference covers all aspects of library and information delivery technology. Michele described an entertaining session on staff ...
